## Using BostonHousing data
```{r BostonHousing}
data("BostonHousing")
housing <- BostonHousing
str(housing)
summary(housing)
```

```{r BostonHousingNext}

partitioining <- createDataPartition(
  y = BostonHousing$zn,
  ## the outcome data are needed
  p = .75,
  ## The percentage of data in the
  ## training set
  list = FALSE
)
#Spliting BostonHousing data into training and testing datasets
training <- BostonHousing[ partitioining,]
testing  <- BostonHousing[-partitioining,]
nrow(training)
nrow(testing)

```
## How to use ridgereg function
```{r ridgereg}
data("iris")
ridgereg(Petal.Length ~ Sepal.Width + Sepal.Length,data = iris)
```
## using caret package
```{r caret}
data(Sonar)

set.seed(107)
inTrain <- createDataPartition(
  y = Sonar$Class,
  ## the outcome data are needed
  p = .75,
  ## The percentage of data in the
  ## training set
  list = FALSE
)
## The format of the results

## The output is a set of integers for the rows of Sonar
## that belong in the training set.
str(inTrain)
## Spliting data into training and testing
training <- Sonar[ inTrain,]
testing  <- Sonar[-inTrain,]
nrow(training)
nrow(testing)
```
